comment: Professor Baldwin is a great professor especially for TPS majors. She drives you to dig deep into your work without putting too much pressure on you if you do not answer something completely correct. Her advice and comments are very supportive and well received. She is a great choice pf a professor if you want to really get into theater.

Totally take her!! She is so amazing. Super friendly, cares, replies super fast to emails, makes class fun even if you aren't super into theatre and gives a lot of extra credit. Also reopens assignments if there is a reason for not completing or if there are issues with something.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Margaret is a super flexible and fun teacher and she teaches play analysis in an interesting and clear way. I learned A LOT about how to analyze, not just plays, but stories in general. The tools she uses are some of the best and the environment is really welcoming and exciting. Even though there's lots of play/textbook reading, it was worth it!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Baldwin is wonderful! She covers the basics of introductory theater in an easy-to-understand way and is passionate about her field. Improvization is entertaining and the group project for the final is fun! If you want to have a fun intro to theater, take this class!

I took the four-week summer session and I have to say there was a lot to do in the short amount of time. Be prepared to read some in order to do well on discussion post. You are required to see one play. Be thorough in all your work. This class is very doable; I took one other class with this and managed to still have high A's in both!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: 4 week Summer online course is tough. Plenty of extra credit opportunities but all assignments takes lot of time and effort. Discussion board posts and responses must be thorough. One outside show attendance is mandatory. Ended up with a high A but had to work hard for it.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I can see why theater majors like her. But if you're not a theater major and all you want to do is pass TPS 1107 for GenEd & get on with your major classes, then DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS! Way too much busy work, too many group assignments, & outside of class events that will literally break your measley bank like plays (ATL parking) etc. It's too much
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: I learned nothing worthwhile from this class. Class consists of doing large quantities of "busy-work" and very little actual teaching. This is made worse by the fact that attendance in mandatory. Also, she assigns significantly more homework than average, and most of it is very redundant.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: I loved this professor. I took her four week summer session class, and although theres a lot of work, it is not hard at all. She is very understanding. The class was condensed, so that is why there was a lot of work. If it was a regular semester, it would have been a breeze. I would totally take her again. Easy A.
The way she explains things can be confusing, but if you participate you will understand very easily.

DEMANDS respect from her students.. After a 3 months she eases into being a cool teacher. You will be watching a lot of plays and reading ones 60-80pages long.. Don't want to leave the readings to the last minute, have to pay attention in class. Kicks you out if she catches you on FB or phone. The performances you will do for "tests" are pretty fun

Margaret really knows what she is talking about. She is so knowledgeable and she is really well respected in the Atlanta theatre community. She always has really in-depth questions that take some critical thinking. You read several plays throughout the course and really delve into the meanings. Participation in class in necessary. An A is possible.

She may seem difficult at the beginning of the semester, but she's really cool and nice. Must attend 3 shows and can get extra credit. I never said a word in the class and made an A. Just do the readings and keep up with her GA view and you'll be fine. She does give homework, but it's all an easy A. Really liked the class.

Professor Baldwin does a good job creating an interesting course and challenging many resistant students to put forth the effort and work to do well in this class. You have to read a few plays, a couple chapters in the book, and do some online quizzes. End of course project is stressful (due to peers slacking) but overall fun. Awesome professor.

For this to be an entry level course, she gave out TOO much work. It was hard to learn anything because we moved so fast in the class. Along with that, she kept changing when assignments were do. Grades too harsh. But YOU will have to stay on top of the readings. She is willing to help you when you need it. Not  clear on how she grades.

Very nice! Read EVERYTHING assigned or you'll be asked to leave class. If you didn't read fess up, she might let you stay. This class was a lot of work and it's not an easy A but she does notice your work ethic so don't slack! I was a little intimidated but I got an A because of my hard work. She also makes class very enjoyable, she's very funny.

FAV PROF IN THE TPS DEPART.!!! So sweet, extremely talented! Worked with her as a director and she's fantastic. 1107 is designed to be an easy class, so it's not too challenging. Book really isn't necessary. All tests and quizzes online and usually gives you 2 chances. Fake some passion about global theatre, and she'll love you right back.
Professor Baldwin is a brilliant playwrite and a decent instructor. I found her class enjoyable, and only mildly challenging.

honestly you have to do the work to get the grade there is no way around it. if you don't read, don't be upset if you are asked to leave. But don't let that scare you away. As long as you are prepared for class, baldwin is awesome and i REALLY walked away feeling like i had learned something! She's great and I would take her again!

By far the most enjoyable class I have taken in college! She was so much fun and I learned a lot about theatre! It's an easy class if you do all your work and keep up with things. Do not disrespect her. She expects your full attention and hard work. I just took this class because I had to and ended up loving it!

I enjoyed her class. In this class you'll have a lot of writing but not more than you can handle. She's a tough grader, but is there to help anytime. You'll learn a lot and the final project is a blast! I would recommend her and as long as you show up and do all the readings, you'll be fine.
Great teacher. I couldn't ask for better

sooo easy! you have 1 or 2 quizes a week but you take them online, you can look answers up as your taking them.the final is a 5 minute group play. u have to go to a few plays but they are intresting. Easyyyyy A. i would recomend taking her forsuree
Very Easy class. Gives tons of extra credit. Quizzes arent mandatory. Test are taken online as well as quizzes. she gives you a substantial amount of time to complete the test and quizzes. EASY A!!

Great professor! Just be aware that you have to attend a couple out of class events and write a small paper about it, but it was not hard. Most of the TPS classes had the same final which was to create and perform your own play. Not bad at all...Take Professor Baldwin!

If you put in the effort required (which is often substantial), you'll learn a lot. If you approach her respectfully about problems, she's very willing to work with you. Constantly changing sylabi can be a bit annoying/confusing. Expects you to work hard and rewards those that do. Watch out for attendance policies!
well I had to take this class.  It was a total waste of time.  She required way too much for an enty level course.  every day she handed out a new assignment.  I didn't learn anything in this class.
Theatre Hiastory is a Lecture Class NOT a Discussion course!!
